I've also been trying to compile the fortran interface with Visual 
Studio.=
net 2003 integrated with Intel Visual Fortran 9. 

I compiled "fct.cpp" and=
 "fctxml.cpp" to a static library, and then 
created a new project with the=
 fortran module files and pointed it to 
this new static library, the exist=
ing Cantera static libraries, and 
the Cantera include directories. On the =
fortran side under external 
procedures, I left the "calling convention" se=
t to "default", 
set "append underscore to external names" to "yes", and se=
t "name 
case interpretation" to "lower case". Multi-threaded DLL runtime 
=
libraries are used on both the C side and the Fortran side. 

When compilin=
g a fortran program that I've been able to successfully 
compile and run un=
der linux, there are only two linker errors:

ct_f_demo  error LNK2020: unr=
esolved token (0A000071) ?__storage@?
$Cabinet@VXML_Node@Cantera@@@@0PAV1@A=


ct_f_demo  error LNK2020: unresolved token (0A0000C2) ?
__storage@Storage=
@@2PAV1@A

Any thoughts?

Thanks.

ella2000" <ryankel@h...> wrote:
>
> David,
> 
> Thank you for the response.=
  I believe I found all the settings you 
> are referring to.  
> 
> 1.  Fo=
rtran project "C-style" argument passing:
> Under the Fortran project prope=
rties -> Fortran -> External 
> Procedures, there is an option for "calling=
 convention" with 
choices 
> of DEFAULT, C-REFERENCE, STDCALL-REFERENCE, S=
TDCALL, and CVF.  Is C-
> REFERENCE the correct choice?  Aren't C functions=
 pass-by-value?
> 
> 2.  Option to generate lowercase names with trailing u=
nderscore:
> Under the Fortran project properties -> Fortran -> External 
>=
 Procedures, there is an option for "Append Underscore to External 
> Names=
" which I changed to "Yes".  This should be good-to-go.
> 
> 3.  Link to Mu=
ltithreaded DLL C Libraries:
> This one seems a bit tricky.  Under the C++ =
project properties -> 
> C/C++ -> Code Generation, there is an option for s=
electing the 
> Runtime Library.  There is Multi-threaded, Multi-threaded D=
ebug, 
> Multi-threaded DLL, Single-threaded, and Single-threaded Debug.  
=
> Also, under the Fortran project properties -> Fortran -> Libraries 
> the=
re are options to select the Runtime Library with similar 
> options.  I fo=
und a good website describing these options at 
> http://h18009.www1.hp.com=
/fortran/docs/vf-html/pg/pgwvfvc.htm.  
When 
> looking over this website, =
I wasn't sure which options to choose as 
> far as static or dll and whethe=
r to use C debug libraries.  Any 
idea 
> what the proper combination of Fo=
rtran and C runtime libraries 
are?  
> 
> Changing the "trailing underscor=
e" option seems to really have 
> opened something up, but unfortunately it=
 is creating even more 
> errors.  I will play around with these other opti=
ons more, I was 
> just hoping for some feedback from some superior program=
mers on 
> these options.  
> 
> Thanks again,
> Ryan
